title: Add integration support for some common external apps
author: sparerd
body_snippet:
Some external apps do not correctly integrate into mRemoteNG using our normal code, but it is still possible for them to be integrated. In most cases, the app spawns a separate process that we need to look for.

Add special handlers for several well-known apps:
- [ ] cmd.exe
- [ ] mintty
- [ ] Git Bash
- [ ] Windows Linux Subsystem Bash

This is related to several issues:
- #649 
- #693 
- #710

iterations.description: Native support for PowerShell, WSL, and cmd is a high-demand feature that simplifies configuration compared to current manual CLI flags.
The issue describes a specific, user-requested integration gap for common shell launchers (cmd, mintty, Git Bash, WSL) that is not fully covered by current behavior.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
I'd prefer to implement this as an interface to keep things easy to manage.
```csharp
IExternalAppIntegrator
{
    bool CanIntegrate(string path); // is this integrator valid for this file
    void Integrate(Process externalAppProcess); // perform the act of integrating the app. not sure if Process is what we really want as an arg here though
}
```

Each app gets its own class to handle integration and the current code for integrating apps can just be moved to a `DefaultExternalAppInteg...
